title: Rear Brake Master Cylinder - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Refit the brake fluid reservoir and its hose to the master cylinder as noted on for removal. Secure with the clip.
Fit the rear brake master cylinder to the right hand control plate and tighten the fixings to
Position the brake pedal to the pushrod, engage the clevis pin and retain it with the clip. Ensure the clip is fitted as shown below:
Reconnect the rear brake switch cable to the main harness.

Position the brake light switch and bracket assembly to its locating pin on the right hand control plate, ensuring the brake switch pin does not foul on the switch plate, and slide the brake switch rearwards. Secure with the fixing and tighten to
Fill the brake fluid reservoir to the maximum mark.
Allow the brake fluid to flow through the master cylinder until fluid just starts to flow at the front brake hose union, collect any escaping fluid.
Incorporating new washers to either side of the union, fit the brake line to the rear master cylinder. Do not tighten at this stage.
Install the control plate to the frame and tighten the fixings to
Refit the rear brake fluid reservoir to the mounting plate with a new lock nut. Do not tighten at this stage. Route the hose through the cable guide on the mounting plate as noted during removal.
Tighten the brake line union to
Refit the coolant expansion tank to the mounting plate with new lock nuts and tighten to

Use only DOT 4 specification brake fluid as listed in the General Information section of this manual. The use of brake fluids other than those DOT 4 fluids listed in the General Information section may reduce the efficiency of the braking system leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident. Observe the brake fluid handling warnings given earlier in this section of the manual.
